Package no.geosoft.jtimeseries

Class Signal

java.lang.Object
no.geosoft.jtimeseries.Signal
public final class Signal extends Object
Model a time series signal as it is defined by the TimeSeries.JSON format.

A signal consist of measurement data of a specific type. The signal may have one or more dimensions.

Author:
Petroware AS

  • Constructor Details

    • Signal

      public Signal(String name, String description, String quantity, String unit, Class<?> valueType, int nDimensions)
      Create a TimeSeries.JSON signal instance.
      Parameters:
      name - Name (mnemonic) of signal. Non-null.
      description - Signal long name or description. May be null if not provided.
      quantity - Quantity of the signal data. Null if unknown or N/A.
      unit - Unit of measure for the signal data. Null if unitless.
      valueType - Value type of signal data.
      nDimensions - Dimension of signal. <0,>.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If name or valueType is null, or nDimensions is out of bounds.

    • Signal

      public Signal(Signal signal, boolean includeValues)
      Create a new TimeSeriers.JSON signal as a copy of the specified one.
      Parameters:
      signal - Signal to copy. Non-null.
      includeValues - True to include signal values, false to not.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If signal is null.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Return name of this signal.
      Returns:
      Name of this signal. Never null.

    • getQuantity

      public String getQuantity()
      Return quantity of the data of this signal.
      Returns:
      Quantity of the signal data. Null if unitless.

    • getUnit

      public String getUnit()
      Return unit of measure of the data of this signal.
      Returns:
      Unit of measure of the signal data. Null if unitless.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Return description of this signal.
      Returns:
      Description of this signal. Null if not provided.

    • getValueType

      public Class<?> getValueType()
      Return the value type for the data of this signal, typically Double.class, Integer.class, String.class, etc.
      Returns:
      Value type for the data of this signal. Never null.

    • getNDimensions

      public int getNDimensions()
      Return the number of dimensions of this signal.
      Returns:
      Number of dimensions of this signal. [1,>.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Return the size (number of bytes) of the values of this signal when stored in binary format.

      Note: For string values the number of bytes needed to represent the longest text UTF-8 string of the signal may differ from the number of characters in the string, as each UTF-8 character may take up 1, 2 or 3 bytes.

      Returns:
      Size of a binary representation of the values of this signal. [0,>.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int size)
      Specify the (maximum) size (number of bytes) of string values of this signal.

      Note: For string values the number of bytes needed to represent the longest text UTF-8 string of the signal may differ from the number of characters in the string, as each UTF-8 character may take up 1, 2 or 3 bytes.

      Parameters:
      size - Size to set. [0,>.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If size < 0;
      IllegalStateException - If the method is being called for other than string signals.

    • addValue

      public void addValue(int dimension, Object value)
      Add a value to this signal.
      Parameters:
      dimension - Dimension index. [0,nDimensions>.
      value - Value to add. Null to indicate absent.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If dimension is out of bounds.

    • addValue

      public void addValue(Object value)
      Add a value to this signal. If this is a multi-dimensional signal, the value is added to the first dimension. This is a convenience method for single dimensional signals.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to add. Null indicates absent.

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int index, int dimension, Object value)
      Set a specific value in this signal.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of signal to set. [0>. If index is beyond current maximum, the signal is padded with nulls.
      dimension - Dimension entry to set. [0,nDimensions>.
      value - Value to set. Null for absent.

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int index, Object value)
      Set a specific value in this signal. This is a convenience shorthand for setValue(index, 0, value) where the client knows the signal is single dimensional.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of value to set. [0,>. If index is beyond current maximum, the signal is padded with nulls.
      value - Value to set. Null for absent.

    • getNValues

      public int getNValues()
      Return the number of values in this signal.
      Returns:
      Number of values in this signal. [0,>.

    • getValue

      public Object getValue(int index, int dimension)
      Return a specific value from the given dimension of this signal.
      Parameters:
      index - Position index. [0,nValues>.
      dimension - Dimension index. [0,nDimensions>.
      Returns:
      The requested value. Null if absent.

    • getValue

      public Object getValue(int index)
      Return s specific value from this signal. If the signal has multiple dimensions, the value from the first dimension is returned. This is a convenience shorthand for getValue(index, 0) when the client knows that the signal is one dimensional.
      Parameters:
      index - Index to return value from. [0,nValues>.
      Returns:
      The requested value. Null if absent.

    • getRange

      public Object[] getRange()
      Return the range (i.e. the min and max value) of this signal. The returned array is never null. The two entries may be null if min/max does not exist.

      If the signal is multi-dimensional, the range is reported across all dimensions.

      Returns:
      The range of this signal as an array of two (min/max). Never null. The entries may be null if no range exists.

    • getStatistics

      public Statistics getStatistics()
      Return signal statistics. Statistics is available even if log data has not been stored.
      Returns:
      Signal statistics. Never null.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Remove all values from this signal.

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

      Testing this class.
